page.title: 13 DODDLESPOOL FARM.
page.content: Doddlespool Farm is a typical farm in this area and has been in the Tredwell family for the last forty nine years.Mr.Tredwell owns twenty eight acres of land and tennants 143 acres.He also owns 12 acres of wood- land.Three people live at the farm Mr. Tredwell,his wife,and his daughter Rachel.The farm is 104 years old.Mr. Tredwell employs 1 worker.He owns 252 animals and 28 of those are cattle.In 1975 and 1976 he cut down and replanted 5 acres of wood land. The trees he replanted were scotch pine, oak, ash sycamore and poplar.The crops he grows are barley and hay.He owns 2 tractors, combined harvester,1 baler and 1 plough .The sheep shearing takes less than one day.Mr.Tredwell gets up at 7.00am or a bit later.The cattle are used for beef not milk.
